Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
February 22, 1861 from William Douglass to Dr. James H. Minor
Monrovia 22 Feby 1861 Dr Jas. H. Minor Virginia Albermarl Couty Dr Sir

I recd your letter per M. C. Stevens and was much pleased with the contents thereof. I have seen Dr Harner in Liberia . I & him came togeother to Liberia and I was very glad to see him again on our shore. it was my intention to have came over in the "Stevens" this time myself but defer it for another times on account of bad news.

I hereby forward you a Receipt for $50.. paid to Dr. G. Hall You will please receive the money and divide it among my chrildrens $10 = each. Please give my best regards to all my friends and relations. also request them to write me as they can about my children. I doeing as well here as I can or could have expected to do in a new country.
I and family are quite well. Trusting these may find you and family in good health,

I am Sir yours humble servant William Duglass N B all the young men of our family left here for Cape Palmus , to join the 4 th regmt to attack a hostile force, in that vicinity yours truly William Douglass
William Douglass to Dr. James H. Minor 1861 February 22
